{"id":262153111,"lang":"cpp","time":"2Â years, 7Â months","timestamp":1568858104,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"28 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/262153111/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Add Two Numbers","memory":"10.3 MB","code":"/**\n * Definition for singly-linked list.\n * struct ListNode {\n *     int val;\n *     ListNode *next;\n *     ListNode(int x) : val(x), next(NULL) {}\n * };\n */\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n    ListNode* addTwoNumbers(ListNode* l1, ListNode* l2) {\n        ListNode* sumList = new ListNode(0);\n        ListNode* ret = sumList;\n        \n        while(l1 || l2) {\n            if (l1) {\n                sumList -> val += l1 -> val;\n                l1 = l1 -> next;\n            }\n            \n            if (l2) {\n                sumList -> val += l2 -> val;\n                l2 = l2 -> next;\n            }\n            if (!l1 && !l2) {\n                break;\n            }\n            \n            sumList -> next = new ListNode(sumList -> val / 10);\n            sumList -> val %= 10;\n            sumList = sumList -> next;\n            \n        }\n        \n        if (sumList -> val > 9) {\n            sumList -> next = new ListNode(sumList -> val / 10);\n            sumList -> val %= 10;\n        }\n        \n        return ret;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"add-two-numbers"}
